pwsh fails to start when launched from WSL with its stdout redirected.

# Steps to reproduce

From a WSL bash shell:

```powershell
pwsh.exe --help | less
/c/Program\ Files/PowerShell/7-preview/pwsh.exe --help | less
```

# Expected behavior

Help output is shown in the `less` pager.

# Actual behavior

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/376504/58821651-87a0d880-8603-11e9-8e1e-8a7358829b3a.png)

# Environment data

Windows 10 1903.  Tried with the latest 6 and 7-preview:

comments.body: This is happening with everything, not just `pwsh.exe`, so it looks like it's a different issue with my machine.  For example, it happens with `node.exe -p 123 | less`.  I'll close this and look for a WSL-specific solution.

title: pwsh.exe can't start from WSL when output is redirected
